review: I don't think I like CPK anymore.. The feel to this restaurant is pretty simple a lot of elderly folks come here which is cool and it seems like that is what it has become a family hang out, not much for a dinner with a friend, date, or just quiet time alone. It was soo loud and the little child next to me kept on making a mess.. The food was tasteless and cold..  The location is nice but I wouldn't come back to be honest...

2 5 stars.  Based on one visit... CP-just oK.  Typical CPK food. Good salads, decent pizzas, good iced tea... Why just 2.5 stars, oh Yelp-addicted one? Here's why.  First, parking is a mess.  Not enough spots.  Tight spaces.  I'd bet they have frequent fender benders in this lot.  Thank goodness the lovely and beautiful M, my terrific but demolition derby-prone wife, does not come to this store often.  I'd have to have a good auto body place on speed dial.  Meeting me here today, I felt fortunate that she parked on Ventura Blvd. Then inside, it took a server 15 minutes to come to the table to greet us, and that was only after I stood up and waved my arms like a football linesman stopping the play clock (you guys know what that looks like).  Our salads were snail-paced in coming out, too.  Not sure what's up with this store, but I didn't have the same management-level service that others had mentioned at this location. To recap:  Decent food, but heads up on the service.  And parking made me consider putting "CPK", "parking" and "valet" in the same sentence.  That just doesn't seem right.

It's CPK, it's decent.   However, if you're even semi-contemplating taking a date here, PUHHHHHLEEEEAASEEE, for my sake and hers, take a moment longer to reconsider.. we live in LA, you're on Yelp, go browse some reviews and find ur lady a more enticing place to dine.  You're welcome, ladies.

Always good food! huge selection and variety for whatever type of food youre in the mood for ;from healthy to deep fried! delicious.But the best part is that Cpk,especially Tarzana is really dedicated to great customer service.They want you to be happy and will do anything it takes to correct it if you're not for any reason.My favorite are the spring roll appetizers,and thin crust pear gorgozola pizza.So good

I live in Encino and this the closest CPK to my area.  Both my kids received gift certificates to eat there from school as part of Reading Rocks (reading a certain amount of books).  We went there today.  The place was packed and have already been waiting at least 30 mins when I realized our gift certificate was for the CPK at Westfield Plaza.  I spoke to the manager and he was immediately sympathetic to me and my kids.  Although he couldn't accept the coupon, he told me that he would still reward the kids and just comp their lunch.  He also congratulated them and told them to keep up the good work! Outstanding customer service, makes for a wonderful lunch experience for my family today.  I am a fan of CPK in Tarzana!

California Pizza Kitchen is always an excellent choice for food. You can never go wrong. However, I do like to support small business but I have never had any thing close to a bad experience at this place. Food, service, cleanliness.... They have it all.

I never ever write reviews, and I love CPK, but this is the first time I have been here since I've discovered I have a gluten intolerance. First off, before we sat down, I asked for a gluten free menu. The hostess said they didn't have one but the nutritional info might help (it didn't). I open the regular menu & there are little circles with "GF" next to gluten free options. This alone definitely wasn't review worthy alone, but c'mon, a hostess at a big franchise restaurant like this should know at least where allergen information is listed.  Anyways, what really got me was that I love the BBQ chopped salad but saw the tortilla strips weren't gluten free. I asked the waitress if they were really flour tortillas (restaurants won't include foods that are processed in facilities that process wheat b/c people with celiac generally cannot process these foods, but I've discussed I can tolerate these foods without issues). She didn't seem too willing to find out for me, so I gave up & ordered the veggie salad (blah!). A few secs later I called her back with a great idea (I really love that BBQ chopped salad... but whats a BBQ chopped salad without a little crunch?). I asked if the chef could crush a few corn chips on top of the BBQ salad for me instead of the ones made for the salad since I saw that they were included on the small bite menu as "GF." Extremely confident that she would come back with great news, she told me "they were really busy and couldn't accommodate substitutions." Sorry, but I didn't realize grabbing 3 chips and closing your hand was that much work. Now, maybe I'm just sick of being gluten free & never being able to have anything yummy without having to pay double the price of a non-gluten free item, but a restaurant of this size should educate their employees and be a little more willing to "accommodate" our simple requests. I know I was in a pizza kitchen, but it's not like I'm asking for gluten free pizza to magically appear (like BJs Brewery and Pizza Cookery)! ;)  It's not just a fad diet people, we really do get sick if we eat wheat, but we still like to enjoy our food. Grr! Anyways, I'll probably give it another shot, but hopefully not at this location!

I've had several very pleasant experiences at this CPK recently. I'm a vegetarian with a dairy allergy, and between the detailed information on their website (they actually have a separate ovo-vegetarian menu which I've never seen anywhere else!) and their very helpful staff, I've been able to get delicious food here without issue. They'll remove cheese (and meat) from any of their pizzas, you can sub avocado for meat, and add more veggies. I usually end up eating what is basically a salad on a pizza crust and it's always really good and very satisfying. Thank you CPK for being dietary-restriction friendly!
Great food- but most of all the BEST salads ever!! My personal favorites are the Bar B Q chicken salad and the Caramelized peach salad!!!

I love going to this CPK.  I think it is their best restaurant. The service is friendly and efficient.  Wither you go in for a quick meal at the bar or take a table for a nice sit down meal, the food is consistently good.  I think I have tried every item in their menu and I did not find anything that I did not like.  Their pizza's are amazing. The Thai crunch salad is my favorite. If you want ketchup or mustard this is not a place for you.  There are times I had to wait for a table  but it was worth it. Highly recommend if you haven't done so that you try it out.

So, we went here and got a booth seat. The wait for a drink wasn't bad or horrible. It was on time, and the waiter was so sweet. He was prompt. He was funny. He took our drink order and came back and gave us all our drinks. I think it was my mom who had to ask again for her wine, but past that, it was good service, since there was no one there, practically( at 11:30am/Noon)empty. When we ordered our meal, it was fairly fast and no wait, like, none at all. Very little wait. I love CPK.     CPK s one of my favorite places. The one thing I didn't like was that there was a family with kids that were screaming at the top of their lungs and I thought that it was going to be louder. The parents did nothing to calm down the kids, either. When they left it was so much quieter. It was so much better. No more bratty kids screaming at the top of their lungs.  Their menus are smaller now. :( I liked when they were bigger and had more soups. And more pizza. It was better before. I loved taking my time to look at the intricate dishes on the menu. My parents were looking for the broccoli soup they had ordered once, and tried to make. I also noticed that they have only two soups...not many to chose from. I would've liked to order my two favorite soups. The potato chowder and the tortilla soup. yum. :) They only have the tortilla soup with is one of my favorites. I highly recommend it, by the way. I noticed that they have a good handful of everything, except the soups. There were only two this time. Only two. Two soups...wow. And the kind waiter let us know that they deleted it by costumer feedback. Why!? I loved the soup selection they had before! I don't care what other people think. The soups were fabulous before!

I'm mostly basing my rating on the food because 90% of the time I usually order online in advance to pick-up (great option, by the way). The parking spaces are tinyyy. Prices are a bit on the high end, but personally I love their food. Their quesadillas are awesome, and I usually get either the chicken chipotle pizza or the habanero carnitas pizza that includes delicious spicy sauce! They give you free bread and butter with take out, so it's a good alternative to dining in. CPK is also where I fell in love with key lime pie.

I usually call in for pick up, and about 50% of the time, the order is wrong...  Please note, the food is consistently good, but not exactly what I order.  And yes, I keep going back, so I get what I deserve- but, I do wish they would check their work- especially when it is placed on line (as opposed to a voice phone call)- then there should always be an accurate reference, right?  Oh well...  Fingers crossed. At least the food is good, and ready on time.

the last time i stepped foot into a CPK was probably about 4 years ago when my parents came to visit me in Irvine. AND for some reason, i remember it being a whole lot nicer.  THIS LOCATION was clean, well kept and the staff was super friendly.  BUT for the PRICE that they charge for their food, i was expecting a WHOLE LOT more in the QUALITY of the food and presentation.  we ordered a thin crust margharita pizza, avocado egg rolls and the bbq chicken salad. the total came out to $38 plus tip. so about $45.00 for 3 people.  1. margharita pizza  - the pizza came out with (what looked like) canned tomato cubes, bits of basil (instead of whole leaf) and a few slices of some salty mozzarrella cheese. the bottom wasn't crispy at all the first time they brought it out and we actually sent it back to be cooked some more.  2. avocado egg rolls - these were money. but maybe because it had a lot of bacon in it (and who doesn't like a lot of bacon in anything). it just didn't taste gourmet in my opinion.  3. bbq chicken salad - this was probably my favorite of the night. chicken was moist. not too much bbq sauce and the ice berg lettuce was nice and cold.  *when i asked for bread, they brought out cold slices of bread that you could buy at a grocery store!!! they didn't even warm them up for us to make it seem like they baked them fresh! i was almost tempted to ask them to toast the slices for us, but decided that it wasn't even worth the effort to ask and eat.  in my personal opinion. for $45 for 3 people. go to BJ Restaurant down the street in Woodland HIlls or Salvemini's Italian Kitchen (GREAT PIZZA). You'll get more bang for your buck...and be able to watch some sports while drinking your beer.  sorry CPK..i won't be coming back.

this is my favorite cpk. everything on the menu is amazing and the service is great! i recommend the tostada pizza and the butter cake with ice cream on top for dessert. the waiters are VERY nice and friendly. a must go!

Healthy style pizza :) I thought about it as Dominos or Pizza Hut. However, this is my first visit and California Pizza kitchen exceeds my expectation.  - It is healthier than I imagined.  - They have many other dishes beside the pizza.  - the service and dine in area is more than welcoming to eat in the restaurant :) the only negative point is the prices and the portion of the food.  -The pizza and other dishes are small  - their prices are hight compared to other restaurant  over all it is 4.5 star  I will give them 5 stars. It exceeds my expectation, really :)
came in for veterans day. and not only did they give us our free pizzas but they gave us another gift card to use another day. thanks cpk for taking care of your vets.
Had the Chinese chicken salad for the 5th or 6th time, and still my favorite dinner choice! Love their restaurant, always just get it to go and wait a max of 10 mins. its very fast :) thanks CPK!
I love this place. Location / restaurant is nice and I always get chicken Milanese. It's by far my favorite dish. Yum

What a waste of money!!!! I went there last nite, since it was packed I assumed it would be great. Big mistake.The egg rolls were way too salty to my taste, the mac and cheese was nothing remarkable. My friend didn't like her pasta either. Maybe they do a better job at the pizza.
Atmospheres great, waiters always remember me, very friendly! One of the rare places that ill go and order something new and I know I won't be disappointed!

Date and Time of Visit:  March 31, 2013 @ 6:30pm Do Not order their Red Velvet Cake.  It's dry.  That said, this place is not bad.  Here's a summary. 1)  Ambiance:  Good  For a casual place, it has good lighting.  Check my photo.   2)  Wine:  Good.   CPK always serves good wine, well stored and chilled right.  Except for the Santa Monica branch where they served me a Chardonnay that was at room temp.  They replaced it of course.  For Chardonnays, I recommend the Kendall Jackson.   3)  Tortilla Spring Rolls (appetizer):  Hmmm, I don't know because I did not try this.  But one of my nieces liked it but my other niece didn't.  So order at your own risk. 4)  Spinach Artichoke Dip (appetizer):  We all liked it!  5)  Tomato Basil Spaghettini:  After you had a drink with some appetizers, I recommend this pasta.  After all, you're kinda full and kinda buzzed so it doesn't matter much, right.  And this pasta is only $11.75. 6)  Red Velvet Cake à la mode.  Skip the cake and just go mode.  The cake was dry. Oh, I almost forgot to add--the service was good, friendly and very competent.

I'd like to start this review by saying that I have always loved CPK. I have never tried something from the menu that I did not like...A few days ago, I wanted to treat my parents to dinner before they left the country to visit Guatemala so I decided to bring them to this location. We had great customer service from our waiter David. My mom ordered the Tequilla Spaghetti and loved it. My dad ordered the BBQ Chicken classic pizza but I added serrano chili to it. (If you love spice, you should try it too!) I ordered my favorite, the Kung Pao Spaghetti with chicken and shrimp. My parents loved it just as much as I did. We ordered my nephew a cheese pizza and he had a great time playing with the children's activity book they gave him while we waited for the order. After our meal, the manager came up to our table and asked us if we enjoyed our meal. I told him this was one of my favorite restaurants and that my parents had never been but they loved it too. He was so glad to hear this, that he offered us dessert on the house! My parents are very hard to impress, and this CPK did everything right. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Many many years ago we used to go to this location often.  CPK is my sisters favorite place to eat so we always wind up eating there when we go out together. After my sister and mother suffered some dysentery upset after a visit to the Tarzana store, it was decided we would go to the Westfield Plaza location.  Indeed we have been going there for the last 10 years. Unfortunately they are moving to another location in the mall and has been closed for many months with the re-opening for sometime "in the summer". The Tarzana location, like many restaurants, seem to "cycle".  Sometimes they are good and sometimes not so good.   I fear this location is going through some PMS at this point. It started with our server Mireya.  She honestly seemed to not only been disinterested but annoyed that she was having to work.   We placed our order, and did ask for some bread with the meal.  Sad with CPK's increase in prices they have gone to a different kind of bread. Rather then those nice slices of soft bread they would bring with butter, they now served a little hunk of "bread" that one would need shark teeth to eat.  Instead of butter they bring a little bowl of oil because they know that one would need to marinate it in the oil overnight in order to be able to chew it, obviously I have no intention of camping out overnight so I can eat it.  So much for the bread.    With my order I am very specific as to how I like the crust cooked.   Now mind you the Topanga location would always get it right and in fact when I ate at this location two months ago after the first attempt they got it right the second time.  So this time our order comes our server plunks it down on the table and skitters off.  I thought it looked a bit overcooked but as always was willing to be open minded and wait and see.  I started eating the lettuce that is served on top of it.  Our waitress- while on the move- asked how everything was- I had lettuce in my mouth, sis mentioned ok.   I NEVER SAW THE WAITRESS AGAIN.  We never got our drinks refilled.  Meanwhile the other servers who were in our area checked their tables often.  Mireya was nowhere to be seen.  Thank goodness I had ordered extra dressing because much like the bread this thing needed to be drenched in dressing to be able to eat. For the record I have all my own teeth and chewing is not an issue for me! How is it that a paper thin crust is so overcooked that one could use it for heat resistant tiles on the Space Shuttle?  It was after 1 PM and I had not eaten in about 24 hours and I was starved.  Since our server never came by I ate about half of it and that was it.  It took my sister another 20 minutes to finish her meal at which time our server finally appeared with our check.   I asked her that if I were to come there again what kind of instructions would it take to get my order correct.  She replied that she supervised this herself and flounced away. The manager came by and was VERY NICE.  He explained that now they are doing the crusts different and there will be no way to get a lightly cooked crust any more. According to him that CPK is going through some changes.  Now they are PRE-COOKING the crusts and then leaving them out.  When its time for them to be used they prepare them and cook them again.  So although I have been able to get it right in the past he said this will no longer be the case.  Again he was very nice and he did take my meal off the order. So kudos to the manager, even though he told me that I can not ever again get my food cooked the way it was before and to my liking.  At least I know that this CPK is off my list for good.  I will give Westfield a chance of course when the re-open. If I am forced to go to this location again with my sister (I sure hope the Westfield location is open in July when I see my sister again) I will just order some water.
Great lunch, i usually get the BBQ Chicken Salad with avocado and a cup of soup.  They also have a wood burning oven that makes great pizza.

this place is ok they have nice drinks, their lemonades are great namely the mango lemonade and raspberry lemonade they food is ok, it use to be great they change their menu so much that is very annoying you crave something you go there to get it, and boom they dnt have it anymore

I came here for "curbside" service around the end of June on a Sunday if the GM cares to inquire. I did curbside not because I'm lazy but because i have a child who is restless.  upon entering the parking lot, the keyes keyes keyes..keyes on van nuys luxury lineup was parked in the spaces designated specifically for curbside and GUESS WHAT..they weren't picking up curbside. If it was not enough that these car owners do not use turn signals but now they are encroaching on CPK's customer's right to pickup curbside? I found a regular parking space, called the lady to tell her that i was outside and five minutes later, I got nothing. I walk in with my little one and wait at the take out line (at this point it was 5 minutes after they said it would be ready) and told the lady i had a pickup order failing to tell her that i was the one who called and was waiting outside. The manager, noticing my demeanor inquired on how everything was and i shrugged and looked away. she continues to engage me and proceeds to ask if there was an issue with the service and i tell her the parking lot is like the wild west of CPK parking lots and that i was unable to park in the designated space in addition to not getting someone to come out after i had called.  at this point the woman helping me with my order is ignoring me because she's probably the one who answered and the manager says to me that she hasn't been paying attention to the parking lot because she has been managing the restaurant, not in a mean way but in a CYA kind of way where she can absolve herself from any culpability for letting autonation park up front, so by that logic, dont' bother telling the manager about a clogged toilet on your visit, because SHE'S managing a restaurant.  I'm no lawyer, but a service that involves your establishment's food is part of managing a restaurant. FURTHERMORE, instead of addressing  the issue she felt like she could have addressed (i.e. not having someone come out after i call) she automatically defers that topic and tells me she's basically not in charge of the spots designated for curbside  . so there you go. you want scorched earth? you got it. She could have said absolutely nothing and i would not be writing this.  one star for getting the order right and for being open when i got there

Coming here was a spur of the moment thing. Me and a friend were cruising for a restaurant on Ventura but when we couldn't find anything that seemed appetizing we passed by this place and found it to be just what we needed. We were starved so getting seated quickly was the best. The waitress was fast on the drinks and was helpful about suggestions and modifications to my dinner. Food was brought out not too much later and it has ok. I've had better pasta plates elsewhere but hey, it's called a pizza kitchen for a reason. They're slightly pretentious in having certain items on the menu but overall the food is made ok. Pizza is their signature dish and I definitely enjoyed trying my friends pizza. He had a margarite pizza which is very basic for my taste, since I like everything on it, but it was great. Good sauce makes the pizza.

One of my favorite CPKS, and it's a standalone location.  All the other ones I've visited have been at a mall. The food is pretty good here but it's just like most CPKs.  Their BBQ Chicken Pizza is always a great choice, but I love anything with Goat Cheese. Pricing is fine.  Each pizza is a little over $10.  It's almost 2 meals worth. Employees are really awesome here!  They seem happy that's for sure. I think this location is the nicest looking,  big windows next to a nice area on Ventura, and there is nice greenery to look out of the windows too.  Tall ceilings, nice booths.  Every CPK should aspire to look like this one.

This CPK is one of the good ones. Though sometimes they have their off days.  I have been coming here quite a while and as a whole, they are a pretty good restaurant. I started coming here more since they decided to ruin the Topanga Mall one by throwing it in the middle of the mall. Call me bland, normal, too original etc. But my favorite pizza here is the original cheese (slightly undercooked so it isn't burned on the crusts)  When I come here, we order two appetizers (Avocado Spring Rolls, Spinach Artichoke Dip and/or Sesame Wontons) they are to die for. I will get my Pina Colada which surprisingly amazing especially with extra pineapple! My friends will get either the California Club, Original BBQ Chicken Pizza or they will tell the waiter to surprise them and we have a new pizza to try!  However, one tip to CPK if I may. Stop trying to change your menu around so much. I understand that you are trying to keep it interesting, but it's slightly becoming annoying. In the past year or two they have changed the menu twice. Now they have "unofficially" taken off the Traditional Cheese from the menu. They did technically replace it with the Five Cheese and Tomatoe pizza which is nothing up to par.  The Five Cheese and Tomato Pizza was the one that our waiter "surprised" us with. We were ultra excited to try it. When we did we were slightly let down. First, there is no sauce, it was to be replaced with the large slices of tomato up on top of the pizza....doesnt compare. They cheeses however are great all together, but once you take off the tomato you might as well be eating a stuffed crust pizza at Pizza Hut....or is it Dominoes that has that? Whichever it is, it was good, just a little bit below the standards of what I would expect from CPK.  Want to save loads of money on trips to CPK if you are regulars like we are? Join the Pizza Dough Rewards. Every $100.00 you stack up you get $5 off. Without knowing it, We constantly get $10-20 every other trip because the whole check is added no matter how much I actually pay. So when you go with a large group and split it you still are getting the points on your own card which is great! (PS one of the hostess here looks just like Luna Lovegood from Harry Potter, thought I would throw that out there)

I always love CPK. The food is pretty standard fresh, plentiful and yummy. I just wish they would stop changing the breads. Go back to the original kind! I love how each salad is made special for you, and you can add or leave out almost any ingredients. The service at this location is always excellent and friendly. The run to open the front door for you, and you ALWAYS get a cheerful recognition when you walk in. Parking is usually a little challenging in the lot though. The spots are a teeny tiny bit too small. Tonight however, we had no problem, and actually had a few choices on a spot. I also love that they have free wifi (why the heck doesn't everyone, I want to know)

We like coming here with the kids. They have good appetizers and a solid kids menu. Ive always liked CPK and love the new one in the Topanga mall. This location in Tarzana is still very good and centrally located to other things we like to visit.

Terrible. Never again. The waters don't pay attention to the tables and they laughed amongst themselves the whole time. We got no service. The food arrived after 30 mins and we got the wrong meal. After telling the wator about it they claimed they didn't hear me corectly so we had to wait more... I don't reccmend this place.

I frequent this CPK a great deal and the food and service is tremendous when you dine in.  I usually get the chicken tequila fettuccine, my wife the margherita pizza and we get my 22 month old the kid's grilled chicken.  All great meals at a great price.  Today however I decided to do takeout.  When I ordered the individual seemed somewhat robotic and not too familiar with the menu.  I had to repeat myself numerous times and correct my final order twice.  When I get to CPK they read me my order and it's completely wrong.  Both pizzas were incorrectly made, one without extra cheese and the other without gluten free crust.  I asked how this happened and the employee told me they outsource their to go orders to a call center in Colorado.  Couldn't they just hire someone extra to take the orders whom was familiar with the menu and on location.   Either way I was pissed and find corporations that do that cheap and disinterested in true customer service.  I still plan on eating here but never for take out again!

I have been going to CPK for many years.The last two times I went ,they have been severely understaffed and I had to wait 20 extra minutes for my food.The previous time,I placed a take ouy order.I was told on the phone to pick up my food in 15 minutes.I got to CPK 17 minutes later. I waited in Line for 15 More MINUTES! and then I waited 21 more minutes to get my food.36 minutes to pick up take out order that was already called in.I told the manager about this,her only words were I'm sorry.When I asked her if she went to a restaurant,and they told her the wait was 15 minutes,and then i did not get my food for another 36 minutes after that time how woukd she feel. Josie the Manager said sorry,if you are not happy tell CPK management. How about i tell all the Yelp people.

Awfully slow service. Inattentive servers with fake painted smile will take ur order & forget about it. We asked the waitress, if a pizza is good enough for 2 people, then we can order a pasta to share as well. With her hand gesture she showed a size, with is probably 6", so we ordered two pizza. After sitting for 45mins (I'm not joking) we asked her how long will it take to get our pizza & she went on the counter & came back to say, '15/20 mins more'! I know, I'm not getting instant pizza or sitting in a pizza-chain, but 1hr for a pizza is outrageous! Then we saw, the guy statred to make our pizza. When we asked about the CPK pizza dough deal (free appetizer), she came back after 15mins with the menu (and our pizza) We already waited enough & wanted to get the hell outta there. The pizza's were pretty big, we could easily share that & get a pasta or something. With stuffs like that & medicore pizza like that...goodluck staying in business. There're hundreds of other places to eat & people sell their behavior with the food as well. Teach your stuffs some manners & then send them to work

Warning:  the worst food I have had in years.  I ignored the other reviews warning me the food was awful and I shouldn't have! Terrible ingredients, deep fried, and poorly cooked.  Old lettuce, and cheap ingredients.  We ordered takeout which was handled by a call center.  They got the order wrong!  It isn't worth calling the 800 number which is 1 800 WECARE!  What an irony.   They don't care.  This chain needs to go out of business.   Do not eat here.  They are not the same CPK!  Ugh!

the service was terrible at this CPK and the food came very late........about 45 minutes to one hour after our group ordered..........the waiter was rude and incompetent................this CPK location really is quite horrible.

The food he is good here, you can always count on it being consistent. The service, on the other hand, needs some major improvement. It gets really slow at dinner time and it took us forever to get our food. But it tasted fine and looked great.

Excellent service. Food came fairly quick. Food was up to CPK standards so it's nothing to complain about. My fiancée got a pepperoni pizza & I just had some lettuce wraps. We both enjoyed our meal. Although the water tasted alright, the ice tasted like it was from the tap. Service was very attentive. Overall, a very positive experience.

The absolute worst CPK in Los Angeles!  This place is terrible.  They are always late with your order and they always "are sorry."  Slow service and they will never make your order right.  They put no sauce on their pizzas at all!!    They must be a franchise.  Because they suck!  Avoid at all cost if you have a pick up order!  This is the only place worst than the Encino location.

Wait staff was very nice.  The food?  Quite, quite overpriced.  The Pasta Bolognese had hardly any sauce - $13 bucks for it, too.  It would have cost me about half that amount to make like 5 or 6 servings of the same thing at home.  The Chipotle Chicken Pizza was good, but did not taste quite right with a thick crust.  Sharky's serves a much better Mexican pizza.  My friend got the 'Two in a Bowl' soup - split pea soup and tortilla soup in one bowl.  Quite a combination...that didn't work.  My other friend got the quinoa & arugula salad, which was pretty tasteless.  I got full, but the food was very average.  With tip, it was $60 for 3 people, including beverages.  $45 would've been about right for the portions and quality.

pathetic service. Me and my gf went here for reunion. We ordered some things to go and we wanted to order as well. They got us a table but even after clarifying that we want to eat there nobody came to take our order for 30 mins.

Cpk has been a favorite spot through my pregnancy and also once my daughter arrived. My mommy and me friends go here quite often during the week and the staff is very accommodating. They don't make is feel like we are carrying the plague like a lot of other restaurants when they see 5 or more moms and strollers. I really appreciate that now that "I'm one of those people" aka a mom with a stroller and a beautiful albeit sometimes fussy baby.

I love almost every CPK that I go to, such a great company.  Always receive exceptional service and food quality is consistently what I want and expect to get.  The quinoa/arugula salad has become my new favorite.  I would like to add that they should offer low calorie cocktails, for example a "skinny girl margarita" or a "skinny mojito".  I was surprised that they don't offer that on their menu.  I asked the waitress if the bartender could make me a skinny margarita and supposedly he said he couldn't.  Which either means he doesn't know how to squeeze a couple of limes or he just didn't want to accommodate my request, Bacardi & diet coke it is!  They did give my mom a cute baggy of chocolate on Mothers Day which I did appreciate.

Excellent location I eat in here four times a week ,mostly I get food to go ..they always get the order correct they are polite and the food always is ready when they say it's going to be and always taste great!
Always great service and drinks. I love the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine; don't forget to add shrimps!! Limited parking. Great ambiance. Friendly staff.
Over all good food. Got the spinach dip for appetizer and wheat crust veggie pizza. The service could be better but still would come back.
The best Chinese chicken salad! I have this almost everyday for my Lunch ! Will be back

Much better service on this visit.  Danny was our server and even though it was his first week he gave us attentive service and was a good sport when Auntie Deanna made her usual crazy requests.  This time I asked for no added salt on my dish and it was much better this time.  The chimichurri sauce they use is very salty to begin with so ask for no added salt if you are ordering off the 'healthy menu'.
Worst service ever!!! Their pizza isn't even that great either and it's over priced. They should consider telling their employees to wear their pants to their waist.

This cpk is very close to my house and I love going to eat here but their takeout is absolutely HORRIBLE!!! I waited 20 minutes for someone to come greet me at curb side and my son likes extra sauce and they ended up giving me little sauce. Unbelievable!! Not only did it take me 40 minutes to pick up food it was wrong! I also got a BBQ chicken salad and they forgot the BBQ.  Going inside to eat everything is perfect but take out don't even waste your time nor money!
My husband tried their chicken piccata and he loved it.  It's nice to find a chain that is so good and consistent with their food!

Went in with my gf for a pizza and a glass of wine. Half way through the meal my gf discover a piece of glass the size of small almond in her mouth while chewing.  We immediately put the pizza aside, called the manager and tried to figure out what was that piece of glass was imbedded into.  After little bit of digging through the pizza, we assumed that it came from the chicken.  Two min later manager shows up, we show her the piece of glass and tell her that we found it in the chicken and that it might be a great idea to run to the kitchen and go through all the chicken to make sure that no one else gets it. Managers reaction was priceless ! Instead of going to the kitchen and worry about safety of others, she puts on this face of doubt, glances at the price of glass that we gave her and says "hmm, this is not glass, it looks like a piece of plastic", and looks back at us. In my mind I was like "is she for real ?!" Then she proceeds to making this "mhmm" sounds when we spoke to her.  After about 3 min of listening to her opinion about that piece of glass that we gave to her and where it came from, she finally slowly walked to the kitchen to talk to the cooks.  While she was gone me and my gf looked closer at the piece of pizza that she was chewing on, and we both agreed that it was imbedded into the dough. When manager came back, we explained to her that we took a closer look and it looks like that piece of glass was in the dough.  Once again instead of going to the kitchen, she looks at us, put on this face of doubt and proceeded with saying "Ohhhh really ? Did you find another pice ?"   I swear if this were barbaric times, I would smash her head with a club to get some common sense into it! After that comment she apologized,  told us that we don't have to pay for pizza, and slowly went back into her office.  Never again will I visit that place. Will file a complaint on here this week.
Meh, I've had better. Nothing impressive. And quite pricey. Doubt I'll go back and I live fairly close.  Not enough bang for the buck.

I used to come much more but since they change the menu, I am not happy. Yes, you can order the old stuff that was on the menu. But it's not testing the same, I still go when I get some CPK craves, but not as nearly as much as I used to visit.

California Club is Salad on a Pizza so much for trying something new back to the Spicy chipotle Chicken!!! Sangria and Bloody Mary yummy great service and nice calm environment!!  First time at this location but closer to the house so I'm sure this is our new location!!!

That artichoke dip is soooo amazing! Also I ordered a BBQ chicken pizza on gluten free crust which was amazing!!!!! Service was pretty great considering the amount of people that were there. I can't really complain about my meal here

It's a CPK, folks. You know what you're getting - nothing less and nothing more. I've found the quality and taste of the food to be fairly uniform among most CPK's I've dined at, and this location is no different. Parking is generally pretty easy in the attached lot, but you can find a spot on the sidestreet if the lot is full. They have pick-up spots in front, too, if you're not dining in.

My favorite CPK location, this place is busy, but the service is always friendly and I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table.  Quality is consistent, you go to CPK and you know what you're getting, this location is no exception.  I love the Pear and Gorgonzola pizza when I can spare the calories, but my go-to option is the Thai Crunch with Salmon instead of Chicken. If you're looking for a CPK location that has consistent quality and friendly servers, this is the place for you!

Went in today and my server was Mervin, all I can say is horrible service. I had to ask him for bread and ask him for a dessert menu. They clearly don't train their servers well enough to do their job. Not going back.
It's CPK. Do you really need a review?  Fine. Be that way. The food is average, but you know what you are getting. Good place for kids.

Why do i go here? Because my kids love the Mac and Cheese and Pizza but not much for me to like- Everything is Bready or Doughy and if you don't get your Dressing on the side, the salads are inedible.  The Tacos are good and the soups are good, the Pastas are lacking but I give it four stars since they get my kids to relax for an hour so I can relax.  Yummy Margaritas.

The staff at this location is one of the best!  CPK has been changing and playing with their menu and I suggest you try their tacos!!! It's soo good They have complimentary valet because let's face it parking anywhere on Ventura is a hassle.  This restaurant is fairly priced! Not expensive and heir portions are just right, sometimes even too much!  I love their salads.. Bbq chicken chopped and their Waldorf is yummmm!  Management is great..sometimes they stop by your table just to see how you like it!  The host is always opening doors and greeting, it's a rare occasion to not see anyone at the host stand!

Okay this may sound like I've been living in a closet but this was my very first time to a CPK. Yes--it's true I had never been to one before.  Taste Test: Food was on point. The flat bread was very, very tasty and the pizza we ordered you could taste the freshness. Customer Service Check: Customer Service was good but had it's shotty moments, such as, multiple people would come up and ask if we needed anything and would all forget to bring what we needed. Great to have several people ask but to not bring back anything is interesting twist.  Ambiance Allure: The look of the join reminds me of a modern dinner with the low booth where you can see everything. I'm always on the fence about that. Sometimes its nice to look around, while other times you wish you could put up barriers and just enjoy a meal with whomever and not see and hear everything that's going on around you.  Bottom line...I'll come back at some point.
My favorite CPK is located in Tarzana. Love their salads and service. Happy to have lunch every day at this location.

Our hostess (didn't catch her name but she had lovely dark red hair) sat us exactly where we wanted to be seated with no qualms. Our server, Nicolas, introduced himself and was very friendly and offered non-alcoholic drink options for my fiancé who doesn't drink liquor. The staff is pleasant, the atmosphere is nice and the area is very clean. Oh, and the food is amazing. Duh.
The carnita tacos were amazing.  Nicholas, our server, was awesome.  Best meal and customer service I've had in a long time.

Service is good we have been coming here for years love the bbq chicken salad. My hobby really loved the rosmerry sandwich which they took of the menu hopefully one day they'll bring it back. That's way cpk will only get 4 star until that delicious sandwich is back

I went to lunch with my friends Christina and John the other day, and we went to California Pizza Kitchen in Tarzana, California. Christina just won the company car for the month, because I pulled her name out of the hat, so Christina wanted to celebrate and chose CPK to eat at. I ordered the Fresh Mango Strawberry Cooler to drink. The first time I got the drink, I noticed two very small hairs in it that weren't mine. The waiter was very nice enough to make me a new drink. It was quite delicious, the only thing that sucked is you don't get any refills. We started our lunch off by sharing an appetizer, the spinach artichoke dip, and boy was it good. It had lots of flavor and plenty of chips left over. The only drawback is I wished they used fresh hot tortilla chips, which would definitely compliment the dip. I ordered the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza, and my eyes were definitely much bigger than my stomach. I should have simply just shared a pizza with John and Christina, but knowing me, I always want my own. I ended up giving John and Christina each a slice of my pizza, because after eating some of the spinach artichoke dip, I was a bit stuffed. The pizza was flavorful, however the crust was way too thick. Also, the crust was a bit lopsided, so it looked like they were in a rush to get the pizza in the oven instead of kneeding it more evenly. I think there could have been more cheese, because there was way too much bread for the amount of toppings they added on my pizza. Overall our lunch took way too long, but I did enjoy my food, and that is the important part.

CPK is pretty solid, and this one is no exception.  I will say that the service, while sometimes a little slow, is very cheerful, and all the servers are fairly pleasant. The food can be just a tad on the inconsistent side.  You will get a salad swimming in dressing one time, and almost no dressing the next, but for the most part, the food is really decent, and the portions are generous. What really makes us come back is the service.  Even when we have to wait, we don't mind, because the servers tend to be so cheerful and outgoing.

I love CPK. I got the tostada pizza and it was delicious but the only problem was that there was a lot of flour on the bottom of the pizza and it made my mouth very dry. Also we got the Mac n cheese balls which weren't that good.

I reallly like cpk and always tell my family to go there for Dinner. They have not been since the big changes have occurred, and they did not like it at all! I have to say, this time around, I was not impressed either. The dough had way too much flour on the bottom and it literally tasted like you were eating plastic (too chewy). The artichoke pizza used to be thin crust, crispy, and delicious. We also order the mac and cheese balls and they came out cold--gross. The waitress kindly took it back and recommended the kids mac and cheese portion as an appetizer. Sadly it barely had any cheese, so it just tasted like you were having fussili pasta. FYI- The tricolore salad is now on a "secret" menu. On a positive note, I do like their new bread! &+ the hostess was very nice & welcoming. Great first impression of the restaurant from her attitude!

I arrived on a Wednesday night at 6pm with a party of six. CPK was packed with some sort of school benefit. We should have gone somewhere else. But the host said "20 minutes". That didn't seem so terrible.  We waited 30 minutes and when the host approached us, he asked, "Is a table okay?" My friend and I stared at him blankly...I was tempted to suggested we actually preferred the floor. Obviously he meant to ask if we preferred a booth. After a moment of our blank stare he said "I have a table over here, but it's in the middle of the restaurant, is that okay?" Way to up-sell buddy. My girlfriend, confused, asked "What's wrong with the table?" "Nothing" he replied, "I just won't have a booth available for another 20 minutes." Again, way to up-sell. Obviously, we took the table. The host seated us and quickly returned with the highchair we needed. However, we were still short one chair for the adults. I ended up grabbing one from an unoccupied table. Hey, that's okay, I got it. Our server arrived fairly quickly, especially considering how busy the restaurant was. She took our drink order and they all came back correctly. That's where her expertise ended. We were ready to order when she returned with the drinks. I asked for the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza with a GF crust. She told me that only certain pizzas could be made GF. Ok...which ones? She listed them off, one of them was the regular BBQ Chicken Pizza. I should note that the only difference (that I could see from the menu) between the Hawaiian and regular BBQ pizza was pineapple. So I asked, can I please have the regular BBQ Chicken pizza, GF crust and add pineapple to it? I swear, the look on her face was "oh, duh". Maybe she was new and didn't yet know how to manipulate the menu. That can take a couple months.  Meanwhile, chaos was ensuing around our table. Maybe this is what the host was trying to suggest when he weakly asked if we wanted to wait for a booth. There were kids everywhere and parents were allowing them to run around the restaurant. I saw one kid almost take out a server carrying a tray full of drinks. I'll admit, I kind of wish he'd bumped into her and gotten doused. Maybe he would've learned to watch where he was going. For the server's sake, I'm glad she was on her toes. It was so obnoxious, my girlfriend asked if we could move tables. We got a blank stare from our server. She said that they were so busy, we'd have to check with the host and most likely go back on the wait-list. And by "we" she meant us, not her. Talk about "full service". So my girlfriend asked the host, but that was a battle not worth fighting. A few minutes later, the server checked on us and asked what we'd decided to do about moving tables. My girlfriend said if it happened, great, but she didn't expect it to. So our server asked, "So should I put your food order in then?" I get it. If she put our order in and we moved tables, the servers would have to switch tables and transfer tabs, plus, our food would inevitably go to the wrong table, go back to expo and get cold while the staff figured out where we'd moved to. I get it. At the same time, there are better ways to phrase what she meant. After the server walked away, I wasn't confident that our order was going in, so I found the manager and explained what was going on. She flagged our server and told her to put the order in. A few minutes later, the server came by the table and said, "So I'll put your order in? You're not going to switch tables after all?" O. M. G. Given all the confusion, our food actually came out rather quickly. I was surprised. Extra napkins and sauces came out when asked, drinks were refilled and all of the food was correct. After dinner, dirty plates were left stacked on our table. We stacked them as a signal to the server that we were done. By now there were many empty tables around us. She came by several times with empty hands, but the plates were never cleared. We ordered desert and asked for the check. She handed the check to my friend and walked over to the computer to put in our desert order. Somebody find the problem here. Eh? Bueller? Half way to the computer, she paused and doubled back. Deserts took forever. We only ordered 2 brownies. The server came back with our check, came back to take the check, returned with our credit card slip and returned a fourth time after that to ask, "Did you get your brownies?" No. No we didn't.  Worst. Experience. Ever.

Best experience ever in a CPK. The food was ok, but I enjoyed the people there the most. The host was super cool, and our server was amazing. So cool. His name was justin and he was the biggest personality. We left a like 50%tip, which is unusual but felt good. For sure gonna go back. Not your typical CPK.

Placed an order for curbside arrival at 6:20. Arrived at 6:20. Called and no one comes out. After waiting 15 minutes finally go inside. Wait another 15 minutes for everything. The most annoying thing is not once did someone say I'm sorry. That's all I hoped for.
California pizza kitchen is all around amazing  The service is great. The workers are very friendly  The food is great, a bit pricey but I would definitely recommend it a restaurant for family 10/10

I would say 50% of my take out orders are wrong so always check your food before driving home only to find out it's wrong or made poorly.  All of my dinners eating inside have been good.  Maybe they have rookies or burnouts handling take out.  Customer service is good they always take care of the problem but while we appreciate the effort we only pay for results.

First time I've been to this location . I m sorry to say I had high hopes but was disappointed. First parking was small and even though they have free valet, you  will have to tip. 2nd concern, although friendly for the hostess, our waiter was not. He never smiled and was not welcoming. He seemed at times irritated with my party, although I know some of people at my table have specific requests on dishes. The waiter would even be more irritated with requests for additional water or utensils for dessert.  The manager was very acoomodating and friendly when we had coupons / asked for things taken off the bill for errors in dishes.  The food was delicious (salads, flatbread, guacamole and chips, brownie dessert) but service of our waiter was awful. Very disappointing. The food and manager have 1 star each. The waiter brought it way down.  Thus 2 stars
Service can be quick or slow depending on the time and day, however the food is decent, the prices are decent, there is nothing authentic or special about any dish.

I have never been to this location, but I decided to give it a try since I live in the area. I was barely greeted by three girls at the host stand that made me feel uncomfortable. I sat at the bar, as I usually do, and had Jean as my bartender. He was EXCEPTIONAL. He immediately greeted me and gave me a such a positive and playful vibe that I joked with him right off the bat. Even though I know their menu quite well, he felt my hesitation and guided me through the menu. I ordered a California Crush, which was too citrus-y for me but still finished, and a Strawberry Lime Margarita, which was great. I also ordered the Spinach and Apsaragus Spaghettini pasta with breaded chicken and it was amazing. Jean really helped me enjoy my time here and because of him I will be sure to come back. He is a bartender so please show him some love and sit at the bar!

I am sorry to say that the hostess ruined my whole meal. The second I walk in there they had horrible attitudes. Something must have happened because they were so rude to me.. Very horrible customer Service. I was so offended I turned around and left.

I never write bad reviews. I only go on yelp to encourage businesses and praise their professionalism. But I have had it with California Pizza Kitchen, esp. the one in Tarzana. On one occasion, there was hair in our lettuce wraps, on another occasion, our Sprites were basically watered-down sparkling water. I ask for extra sauce and they always forget. Tonight, I ordered the Chicken Piccata and I rushed over there before they close. I come home and instead of the Chicken Piccata, they have given me some spicy green Fetuccini, which I couldn't even eat a bite of b/c I'm allergic to spicy foods. And they were closed and I couldn't go back and get my order corrected. How on earth does Chicken Picatta get mistaken for spicy Fettucini? And they had forgotten the extra broccoli I ordered. The staff is always rude and act like they're doing you a favor and the time I told them there was hair in the lettuce wraps, they acted like they were frustrated with me. And and no time did I cause a scene or even told them it's gross or whatever. I just told them point blank that there is a long black hair in there that doesn't match that of anyone I'm dining with. I used to love CPK, their food, their service. I'm done. It's really not that complicated...I order a meal, I pay for it and I expect what I ordered. Too much to ask for? Apparently. I'm really not a demanding customer, but the unprofessionalism at this place and most of the other chains is just unacceptable, time and time again. Do the managers/corporate office even read these reviews to hear what's going on at their restaurants?

CPK has always been one of my favorite places to dine in. It has honestly been part of my life because I had close family worked there around the time it exploded around 1998. I am not the type of person to complain about anything but I felt like I had to write this review. So Sunday afternoon I decided to take my mom, grandma and girlfriend to eat at CPK. They all know I love it!! The service was good. I don't know if they got new cooks or something but we order 3 pastas which were  the chicken tequila, the Kung pao spaghetti and the famous Jambalaya. We also order avocado rolls. First of all the pastas were horrible is like they dip them in water or something. They tasted nasty to be honest. The rolls were super greasy and left a bad taste on our mouths. We order the famous bbq chicken pizza and we got the Thai pizza. It was not even cut right and super dry. We just took everything home because my family and girlfriend are not the type who complain. My girlfriend wrote to corporate and they just said sorry for the unconvinced like they didn't even care. That got me more upset because the bill was $108.00 and all the food was horrible. Maybe is our fault for not complaining that we didn't tell anybody nothing at the Resturant or our waitress. I just know I won't be going back and never taking my family to this location!! or CPK overall. I wish corporate cared more hopefully the management from this location do after seen this.

This CPK location surpassed my expectations.  I haven't been to a CPK in a while, and maybe this one is fancier than most but I was impressed. My family came during the dinner rush for my step dad's birthday.  There were 4 of us and we were told it was going to be a 15 min wait, which we expected. When we were seated my sister noted that the menu seemed longer than another location we were used to going to In culver city, but again that could be due to the amount of time that had passed since we went to a cpk.  There were a lot of new summer drinks and dishes to try. I got the seasonal harvest sangria which was good, and my sister got the white wine sangria. She normally hates alcohol,  but for some reason she loves that sangria. I think it tastes more fruity than most cocktails.  Between the two of us,  we shared the ribeye with argula and potatoes as sides. Everything was cooked well.  My mom got the lettuce wraps with chicken, and she liked it so much that she asked for more of the peanut sauce to take home with her leftovers.  My step dad got the chicken tequila fettuccine,  which is a classic favorite of his that he enjoyed.  My brother wasn't there, but wanted the meat lover's pizza and even though they took it off the menu, the server said that they could make it for him, which was really nice.  The seating hostess, server, and food runners all provided excellent service. I now understand why this location is as busy as it looks, and would be happy to come back to in the future.

They now charge for extra sides of dressing..interesting new policies all of sudden...the manager Jimmy gets worked up and decides to refund the $2 we just simply asked why is that they are doing this now. I will never come to this CPK again. Extremely disappointed in the attitude the manager gave us after we come here all the time. He was extremely aggressive and mocked us for the amount of side dressing we asked for.

CPK has always been a good choice when choosing a place for my employees to have lunch or just on a normal night but after many years of eating here I just experienced the most aggressive manager. We come here often and we are pizza dough members. We asked the manager why they now charge for extra ranch. Jimmy the manager returned the $2 in cash and put it out on the counter we left the $2 on the counter because it was a complete  insult. The manager Jimmy that responded this way not only insulted us by holding the ranch up and saying "you think this is free" take out friends beware. We will never be back at this CPK
Love the food.  Always walk out full and content.  Service is good, though at times it is a little chilly inside.
Good upgrades at the restaurant, good service, and menu has been upgraded. The menu has been expanded and the decor is much nicer than most CPKs. The server today, Heidi, was amazing!

We were there 4 people, sat down to eat. We all order at the same time. Drinking came pretty quickly, but the food - took forever!!!  We waited so long, has been serving our fill of bread that came at firs. Really disappointed.  Overall their food is delicious but why it took so long to bring it? !

I'm so like this them c.p.k but this one is not the same filling like i haet on the 5 different places basically is good pizza and nice pasta but this time last night I fill is not the same thing like all the time  Please take care

Two stars because the food tastes good, just like every other cpk. But -3 stars because the service was absolutely terrible. First when we sat down we ordered soda and what we got were carbonated water. When I asked to have it changed the waitress rolled her eyes. We understand that soda machines run out of syrup and they need to be changed, but we don't understand the need to for the eye roll. Very disappointing. My fiancée ordered a pizza but she requested very specifically no cilantro and she stated that she was allergic. Well guess what, the pizza came with cilantro. We asked to have it changed to remove the cilantro, the waitress then said "but there's only a little bit?" Hmm maybe the staff needs education on FOOD ALLERGIES.  Maybe we were unlucky and got a terrible waitress. But we shall not return.

I don't know why this CPK is so much better than the others but it is. Food is great, service is great, but parking kinda sucks when it's busy. Catering service is excellent but they offer delivery during lunch only.  If you call in, they'll bring the catering order to your car so that helps. Excellent salads & the grilled chicken chimichurri is to die for!!! Get extra chimichurri sauce though- that's the best part! :)

Ordered 2 pasta dishes tonight as well as a couple of appetizers Togo for curbside pickup. I arrived at the designated pickup time, made the phone call to let them know I was there but no one came out. After waiting for almost 20 minutes and it getting close to closing time I decided to go in. The order was just being finished up and I got the food and headed home. At home the first problem was a missing dipping sauce that was supposed to be with one of the appetizers. The other appetizer (spinach artichoke dip) had stale chips with it. The 2 pasta dishes were downright awful. I don't think I will ever eat CPK again. Yuck.

Omg ordering pick-up is the best! They recognize ur phone number and greet u by first name! It's really nice :) I love the plank salmon, can't go wrong there! This CPK is soooo lovely! Very happy with every experience i have had there. Oh, make sure u download their reward application! Earn points for free appetizers and desserts (not that I eat the desserts but it's nice to have the free option in case I am feeling weak)

Horrible parking situation, they have pick up only signs in front of parking spot and then there's yellow painted curbs. Apparently you can't park in either spots.... The low life that works the door picks and chooses who can and can't park there. Absolutely pathetic to have to move you car down the street and then watch people park in those spots who aren't picking up food.
Absolutely great service im not the type to  write reviews but i was a first time custumer here and the manager even gave us a complimentary  entry

Food was excellent Staff was extremely helpful Menu was easy to read and any questioned were answered Server actually went over the menu before hand Priced very well Good quality food and and drinks Awesome environment

A gradual decline...  Most items are still good but it's not what it used to be.  First, the prices have gone way up. Even the Cheesecake Factory is cheaper now.  I ordered the Moroccan Chicken Salad which sounded amazing on the menu. What a disappointment! A sprinkle of good ingredients on top of a bucket of cheap lettuce. For over $16 I expect better.  Their pizza is still good but they won't be seeing me there for a while.
I love it here. Been coming my whole life. Always get great service and food. Had Victoria tonight, she was fantastic and so sweet and personable. Thank you!
Horrible!!! Sat for a little over ten minutes with all the servers passing by and not ONE asked us how we were doing or took down our drinks order!!!

I dont even want to give you one star!!!!! This was trully the worst experience I ever had EVER at cpk!!!! I dont understand what is going on with cpk!. I have to go to certain cpks to get my chicken Chipotle thin crust with avacado bacon extra bean corn salsa to get it right really!?!??!? I visited your tarzana location tonight n had the WORST EXPERIENCE EVER AT A CPK!!!!  I gave them 3 tries to get it right n failed miserably each time! !!! The last try the Manager drops a plate of avacado on my glass and breaks it shattering glass pieces all over everything!!!!! I'm leaving your restaurant HUNGRY AGAIN CPK!!!! unfreaking acceptable CPK!!!! I spend MONEY at you're place bring family n friends here but never Again cpk. Been a loyal pizza dough account holder but after today I'm so let down.  Tonight really killed me with u guys. Completely unacceptablel!!!!! Just sucks CPK!!!!!

Full house on Friday night! 7:30 Waited half hour which is suppose to be just 10 min. Was waiting outside (which it was just me and my sis outside, coz full in waiting area inside) and missed them calling us! I still wonder how we missed that call when we're not that far from the door and was just sitting down on the bench. Hmm....Nways, food was great but expensive. I gave it 3 star because of the half hour wait on an empty stomach. Hence the short temper and the 3star. And also the food servers didn't come back after she served our drinks.  I already checked in on Yelp, gave review and inhaled the bread, and she's still hasn't come back. I'm hungry!

Having windows facing a busy boulevard, it's not the most attractive CPK, but the slightly overpriced food is always fresh and delicious and the service is always attentive (we were served by a nice girl who looks like 1989 Madonna).  A few chairs still needed bussing when we came in, but it was lunch rush. Club turkey sandwich and spinach/quinoa salad were fine, good but not remarkable.  The bread to start here is sourdough do.

The food was mediocre, but the service is what set me off. it took us 50 minutes to get a butter cake and our check. once we received our check it came and was wrong, it took us another 10 minutes to find our server. wasn't until we asked other servers that he finally came back with our check. highly disappointed!

We were celebrating a birthday tonight with 12 people! Our server Dayne was beyond Great!  But we began noticing "ants" crawling on our table and on the booth!  We called over the manager, Mark and he saw them.  At a two top next to us my daughter found many ants crawling all over the utensils and the table.  Ewe...  The manager offered to move our party and we did!  One would think the manager would have offered desserts or a discount, "Nothing!"  We paid our bills and left!  Not very good Customer service!

Simple and straight , it's just average here.  Nice parking lot and easily accessible as its the only structure. So you avoid the mall and all that traffic stuff to get to a simple joint.  The chips with artichoke dip was really good, but too many chips and not enough dip. So dip needs to increase ;).  I had the jambalaya and it was with chicken, crawfish , sausage, and shrimp over pasta. Average dish! Nothing special. The best jambalaya is at Cheesecake Factory when you assess comparable restaurants and prices.  Services was pretty good as well. Vanessa was helpful and although my mom comes off with an attitude often,she was not phased by her. I did wonder why Vanessa noted to us she was away for a few minutes to speak with her attorney. I hope there's no domestic violence involved as she is a cute thing and I could see someone get in a jealous rage if they found out there was some hanky panky going on with someone else . If this happened to me, I would be more understanding if she was with a girl ;).  Sticking to topic of the restaurant , it was OK and I am not eager to go back.
Good was good Very good service  Absolutely come back again  The halibut is taste very good  The prices are reasonable too

At this location I encountered a terrible attitude. I went to this restaurant because I've always come here. Good food at a decent price but today was very different. From the moment I asked for a little more time ordering, my waitress acted like I had offended her. And, her service not only came with an attitude but it also came very late. I contemplated giving no tip and asking her to change her attitude.

Worst service. Came in with our 2 kids. Waited to be seated after they took several non-kid parties to be seated in front of us. Ok, understandable since they needed a place for the 2 highchairs. Then we were seated and after 15 minutes of no contact asked a passing server if she knew if we had a server for our table. She said she didn't know and she'd check. Never came back. In the time it took us to load our kids back up and leave not one employee of the restaurant approached us or noticed. It was going on 25 minutes at that point. Never. Again.

Food is mediocre. My family and I went on a Saturday and received horrible service. It took them 25 minutes to take our order and they messed up the simplest things - like the number of waters we'd asked for or warming up our bread. Needless to say, my mother was not pleased with the service, especially with it being her birthday celebration. After talking to not only our server but also the manager, we were met with no accommodations for our experience. I'm upset that we had this happen since my family and I have been going to CPK devotedly for almost ten years, although the majority being the Northridge location. A waste of $36. Will not be coming back.

I came here with my family on a Monday night. Food was same as always, 7.8/10. But the CPK service had changed. No longer were the waiters always checking up on your table. Our food took over 35 minutes to make too. Very anti climatic. I've never had an experience like this at CPK before and I've been going here almost my whole life.
Customer service is horrible, so is the manager Josie! Laughed in my face when i told her the order was wrong. Worst location!

Food is always consistent here, place is clean and has been recently updated. My issue is just always with the service. Multiple times that I have visited this particular location I felt like there were more servers sitting down and having meals with their friends than servers to actually serve. Just where I was sitting there were about 10 tables occupied and 3 of them had more than one server sitting with friends/family enjoying meals. Okay, they must have been on break, BUT one table had like 5-8 workers (all with name badges). It took our section forever to get food and drinks. The hostess was seating people and bringing out bread because so many servers were "on break" . Here's an idea! Maybe everyone should take separate breaks so that there are always enough servers to actually serve the patrons. lol it was just  a little silly and all of the tables nearby were talking about it. I'm not at all saying that the servers don't deserve breaks, BUT do they all have to take them at the SAME time? lol The manager needs a refresher course, I personally have never worked anywhere where the whole team was given breaks all together like that. Poor management skills are to blame so i'll give them 4 stars for the food, our server (who was doing his best to help all the tables in that section), cleanliness and price.

Just returned from this place.Horrible service. The server got our orders wrong and never came back to check on us. Asked for the manager, and the manager didn't even show up. I left without giving a tip and will never return to this location!!
Bad experience. Tables were very shaky. Soup and appetizers arrived after the entree. Management needs to improve.

In the past found a piece of hair in the pizza  but decided to give them another chance. A few  weeks later ordered a kids  grilled chicken that  was not grilled enough, it was raw in the middle. As far as placing a to go order, good luck. They have a call center that never gets your order right. Its like playing the game telephone where a bunch of people sit in a circle and whisper in the persons ear. It goes around the circle only to end up being entirely different, bad communication. Waited 6 minutes on hold to place a to go order and 55 minutes for a simple order that was quoted a 20 minute pu time, and of coarse the order was incorrect. Bad management skills, unprofessional and insulting answers.

I've come here several times before since it's close to my work.  Sadly I know we all get busy, but when a customer comes into pick up their places order the server should give you their undivided attention instead of their back cause they assumed you weren't ready.  Then only to be waiting a little extra so she can chat it up with her fellow staff member whom just showed up for work m, to discuss what she did the night before, or whatever their convo was. You have a job, you chose to serve people that come into your place of business, so chose to deal with girl time chattiness on your lunch time instead of wasting mine.

To start let me state that I will never be visiting this California Pizza Kitchen again due to the lack of respect and customer service that I experienced at this location. Our server (Ryan) started out great by giving us bread and our wine quickly but things went downhill shortly after that. After my family - except my father! - had our food delivered we waited for the last plate to arrive... and then we kept waiting. Ryan came back and told us that our lack of a request for a side order held the meal up. After another 10 minutes (now 20 minutes) Ryan changed his story saying that there was a mix up between tables and our food wasn't entered. All of this aside, we just wanted to pay (DIDN'T WANT A COMPED MEAL) and leave after speaking to a manager about our experience. Apparently this was also the wrong move. The manager "Jamie" came to our table to listen for around 2 minutes before walking off the second we said we would pay and leave. I personally told her after (verbatim) that I felt disrespected and that I felt we received poor customer service. The response to this was that we had said that we would pay and wanted to leave so she left. Apparently this is what I pay CPK's inflated pricing structure for.  I had one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant (including fast food) and it was ONLY because of how "Jamie" treated me and my family. I won't be coming back (not that Jamie cares) and I am calling their corporate office tomorrow (another first) just to complain about the lack of ownership of their manager. Beware if you come after 5 p.m. and have anything negative happen during your dinner as you will be paying the price. FREE ADVICE: When a customer says that maybe another location would be better suited to a larger rush crowd for a fundraiser, answering with "I beg to differ" is not very constructive and a weirdly argumentative way to say that you disagree.
Wonderful service! Love the atmosphere of the restaurant, especially for families!! I have only had good experiences at CPK.

BASIC FOOD! All their food is frozen and then they heat it for you..... I know this for a fact. They are overpriced for the type of quality of food they serve. There service was also terrible, I never saw my waiter and when I did he did not notice I was calling him.

Great service and food had the pot stickers.  Super delicious and had the quinoa and arugla salad and the salted Carmel pudding and was filled up and left happy! The food was fresh and the bartender was very friendly!

The BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad is a staple at CPK. There is too much cilantro in the recipe, but it's a crowd pleaser nonetheless. Not a fan of avocado added on to the salad.  Recommendation: if you order to-go, request that they give you more BBQ sauce containers (2-3 extra). The normal is one small, half-filled container, which isn't enough to coat the whole salad. I'd also ask for more ranch dressing too (just in case). The Baked Potato soup is also quality (for a high-ish end pizza chain), with chunks of potato soup. It's good, but not as good as their old Potato Leak soup, which they discontinued a while back. I used to really like the pizza, but maybe my food tasters have changed (or the quality has gone down). The crust is very doughy and the actual topping portion of the pizza is too small. Speaking of which, I think the diameter of the pizza has gotten small since or late (not sure about this).

So, we live blocks from this place, and we go at least twice a month. The can get REALLY busy, but they manage to keep up well. Service is always great, and the food is always tasty. If they do make a mistake they fix it right away! Prices are reasonable

Waited 26 minutes past our pick up due time at the curb side pick up, didn't complain at all and Ryan was great, get home and this is the slop we get, crushed key lime pie, just a mess, so not cool, even during the wait they said so sorry this is taking so long a manager will come see you (we never asked to even see the manager) but then the food finally came out and they said the manager too busy to come see you, I think I'm done with it here, too bad. I actually want to give one star but I'll give two cause Ryan was pleasant.
Best service we've ever gotten at a restaurant. Amazing food. DELICIOUS bar drinks. What a wonderful experience! I rarely go on Yelp to bother with a review. That's how good it was!

First time at this location and it was an amazing experience. Waited no longer than 5 minutes, one of the managers Josie sat us and she was very kind. She brought us out an appetizer sample to try since it was our first time there and it was very good! (White corn guacamole) we tried the avocado club rolls and a new breakfast pizza which both were soooo delicious! I don't know which I liked better, both were so great. Our server Moriah (not entirely sure that was her name) was really nice and helpful. Overall it was a great experience at CPK and I can't wait to go back for the great food! Thank you Josie and staff, you guys are awesome.

#SMH at tonight's service. Getting seated was a breeze, this spot is usually our fam go-to place, always greeted with the warm welcome never fails.   I should have walked alway after 20mins of no service after being seated.  Everyone around us seems to be getting service... But my patience was rewarded after the house manager comped  our "mommy-son dinner date" (one star for that) Guess just came in a really "busy busy Sunday service" but this is a restaurant business right?? That's no excuse.  Hey anyone can have an off night (server, kitchen staff, etc..) but one person's "off night" sets the tone for the entire place and experience.  This one is a perfect example.

I forgot how good the pizzas are here. Love the salads here to. They give you big portions even when it says half order lol. I don't mind that tho. They have cocktails and wine here as well. New agave nectar cocktails this week but haven't had the chance to taste it.

I had given this restaurant a 5 star rating before but now it's down to 1 because of the service and management I've recently experienced. My husband ordered an iced tea and drank a little then left for work. I stayed by myself to finish my meal and drank the rest of his iced tea bc I wasn't going to let it go to waste. The server brings the bill and charged us 2 iced teas. I bring it to his attention and he said well you were drinking the iced tea. But I never ordered my own iced tea just drank the rest of my husbands. He changed it, but when he brings the bill back he added a charge of $2 because I asked for my chicken to not have seasoning. I have never been charged because I wanted something taken OFF my food. He claims that CPK had to cook new chicken because they pre marinate their food. Why is that my problem? Not everybody wants their meat seasoned.  The manager Jaime came and she is one of the rudest individuals I've ever had the displeasure of meeting. She is unpleasant to talk to so if you have a problem dont even bother asking to see a manager she is no help. She made it very clear that CPK's outlook on service is "give me your money, don't care if you come back."  Very displease, this was my third time eating here in the last week and it was the first time I had an issue with my food and service.
